text: One day a certain Gallo, digging the ground, found a Pearl, and gave it to the first stonecutter he found at hand. "Well, I think so", he said as he gave it to her, "but any grain of urine or oats is better for me. An ignorant man inherited a manuscript and took it to the nearby bookstore. "It seems like a merit thing to me", he told the bookkeeper, "but, to me, any florine or ducat is worth more. FIN
title: El Gallo y la Perla
author: Jean de La Fontaine
